channel.title: Data Visualization on p( ssp3nc3r | Columbian )
channel.description: Recent content in Data Visualization on p( ssp3nc3r | Columbian )

item.title: NYC bike share rebalancing information graphic
item.description: We continue exploring the NYC bike share program. This time we create an information graphic visualizing bike and docking station availability by time of day and rate of new rides per minute.

item.title: Approximating the components of Lupi's Nobel no degrees
item.description: Exemplary, award-winning information graphic Approximating the reference in R An exercise in design using R Data for Lupi’s display Main display of points and lines Per-category histograms or bar charts Per-era stacked bar charts Sankey diagram Next steps References Exemplary, award-winning information graphic Giorgia Lupi is a master at designing information for visual narrative — telling stories through visualization. Her portfolio includes a series of exploratory data visualizations published for the largest circulating Italian newspaper, La Lettura.

item.title: Exploring CitiBike ride data
item.description: Background The Challenge How can we identify causes, relationships One approach for this analysis Identified data of measurements CitiBike ride data Alternative transportation data Weather information Traffic information Beginning data exploration — daily bike usage Background In 2013, the NYC Department of Transportation sought to start a bike share to reduce emissions, road wear, congestion, and improve public health. After selecting an operator and sponsor, the Citi Bike bike share was established with a bike fleet distributed over a network of docking stations throughout the city.

item.title: Visual exploration of starting pitcher duration
item.description: Introduction Exploring influence of times-through-the-order on manager decisions Describing survival with a life table Modeling survival with conditional logistic regression Exploring game states (context) on pitcher survival Runs accumulated Baserunners accumulated Outs in the half-inning Platooned matchups Pitch count Further work Appendix Variables as cleaned for these analyses References Introduction This analysis explores major league baseball decisions of when starting pitchers are removed from the game.

item.title: Toeing the Line: Altuve and Trout
item.description: Analysis Load and combine data Summarise and prepare data Getting running speed from timestamped coordinates Define variables Graphical overview of coordinates and running speeds Scenario 1: times to first when attempting a double Scenario 2: batters trying to beat a throw to first Conclusions and Next Steps In these analyzed data, described below, Trout demonstrated slightly higher expected footspeed and slightly shorter expected times to first base than did Altuve; although their performance is close and we expect a near toss up, given the data used, as to who comes out ahead on any given play.

item.title: Languages Behind Statistical Learning, and Useful Tools
item.description: R Markdown—a tool for reproducible reporting From mathematical notation to R Linear Algebra Calculus Probability Distributions Regression Optimization Gradient descent Simplex method Algorithms Data and model visualization Organizing Data Closing “Can A.I. Be Taught to Explain Itself?” That’s the question recently posed in The New York Times Magazine. A search uncovered helpful references — An Introduction to Statistical Learning with Applications in R and The Elements of Statistical Learning, for example — but none with A.
